posts.post_content: [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) is already unblockable, PatrickWamsher. Things with protection can't be damaged, enchanted, blocked or targeted by anything they have protection from. Since Progenitus has protection from everything, he can't be blocked by anything.

Posted By: MagicNovice (8/23/2010 7:30:24 PM)

posts.post_content:
Things to note about this card:  
+1: He's a white wizard.  
+1: He's one of the few white cards that sacrifice themself.  
+1: He's decent in limited.  
+0: Gives strong stuff temporary evasion by sacrificing.  
+0: Decent flying chump block.  
-1: One mana too expensive.  
  
Overall, I believe this would be a good card in limited (cause it has flying AND gives your bombs evasion). But in constructed, there are a lot better cards at this mana cost. I enjoy the flavor of this card - power to white wizards!  
  
2/5
posts.html:

Overall, I believe this would be a good card in limited (cause it has flying AND gives your bombs evasion). But in constructed, there are a lot better cards at this mana cost. I enjoy the flavor of this card - power to white wizards!

2/5

posts.post_content: Personally, I think he's a decent card for a Naya P5+ deck. The fact that you can only use him once is a bit of a downer, though, especially in Commander (unless one of said 5+ creatures is Sun Titan); he might've done a bit better if it had been something like "{1}{W}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains flying". Not as great for quick evasion, but it'd let you get more use out of him without having to pull him out of the graveyard every time you want to attack.
posts.html:
Personally, I think he's a decent card for a Naya P5+ deck. The fact that you can only use him once is a bit of a downer, though, especially in Commander (unless one of said 5+ creatures is Sun Titan); he might've done a bit better if it had been something like "{1}{W}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains flying". Not as great for quick evasion, but it'd let you get more use out of him without having to pull him out of the graveyard every time you want to attack.
